# Containers Docs

> Building and publishing .NET applications as container images without a Dockerfile. The .NET SDK includes built-in container support via `dotnet publish` with container properties. Use `EnableSdkContainerSupport` in your project file; publish to Azure Container Registry, Docker Hub, or other registries.

- [.NET SDK container creation overview](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/dotnet/docs/refs/heads/llmstxt/docs/core/containers/overview.md): Learn about the .NET SDK container creation feature, including telemetry, publishing considerations, and build properties.
- [Containerize a .NET app reference](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/dotnet/docs/refs/heads/llmstxt/docs/core/containers/publish-configuration.md): Reference material for containerizing a .NET app and configuring the container image.
- [Containerize an app with dotnet publish](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/dotnet/docs/refs/heads/llmstxt/docs/core/containers/sdk-publish.md): In this tutorial, you learn how to containerize a .NET application with dotnet publish command without the use of a Dockerfile.
